message:
Hi! How can I return HTTP 400 in a tastypie Resource?
This is my code http://dpaste.com/539764/
Probably by raising a notfound error. I don't have a lot of experience with tastypie though. https://github.com/toastdriven/django-tastypie/blob/master/tastypie/exceptions.py#L21
NotFound would presumably return an HTTP 404

thank you very much :)
I didn't found this on the docs :(
That's  lot of code just to return a 400 :/
@zeeg It's obviously just the last line that does the return
FWIW, a simple "return HttpBadRequest(…)" in your resource's get/post list or detail handler also works.
@issackelly I was only talking about the last line :)
@issackelly in our api its raise self.Unauthorized, and it has a default error message
@Zeeg nice, whateve works for you, tastypie is the best us plebeians have ;)
